content.title: Investment Promotion Scheme (IPS) for MSME Sector: Assistance For Quality Certification
content.state: Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu
content.department: Dept. of Industries, U.T. Administration Of Dadra & Nagar Haveli And Daman & Diu
content.details: The scheme 'Assistance For Quality Certification' is a sub scheme under the 'Investment Promotion Scheme (IPS)' for MSME Sector. It was launched on 3rd July, 2015 for a period of five years and has been extended further from 20th May, 2022 to 19th May, 2027. The objective is to provide incentives and assistance to the MSME Sector to nurture them and protect them from market vagaries, maximize women participation, reduce unemployment, and incentivize industries to employ resident laborers.
benefits: 50% of fee payable to certification for National/ International Certification.
50% cost of testing equipment and machinery required for that certification up to a maximum amount of ₹10,00,000/-.
eligibility: Should be a New Manufacturing/ Service units or Existing Manufacturing / Service units which undertakes Expansion/ Diversification in MSME sector.
The unit should have commenced the commercial production between 20.05.2022 to 19.05.2027.
The unit should be located in the U.T. of Dadra and Nagar Haveli & Daman and Diu.
The unit should acquire the certificates from certifying bodies, registered with National Accreditation Board for Certification Bodies (NABCB).
The Enterprise shall have to apply within one year from the date of issue of the Certificate.
exclusions: The enterprise will not be eligible if any certification is required as a part of statutory provision.
documents_required: Goods and Services Tax Number (GST) Document.
Copy of Udyam Registration /Industrial Entrepreneur Memorandum, as applicable.

Copy of Partnership Deed and Firm Registration Certificate in case of partnership concern or Memorandum & Articles of Association and Date of Incorporation Certificate in case of Public/Private Limited companies.
Copy of land purchase deed duly signed by the applicant (If the Enterprise is functioning in its own land).
Copy of registered lease agreement for a minimum period of 5 years from the date of commencement of commercial production (If the Enterprise is functioning in a leased land/ building).
Copy of sanction order from Electricity Department for power supply with copy of the latest bill.
Copy of Consent to Operate / Renewal from PCC, DNH & DD (as applicable).

faqs.question: What are the National/ International Certifications for which subsidy is provided under this sub-scheme?
faqs.answer: Subsidy is payable for the certification of Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS), Indian Standards Institution (ISI), World Health Organization (WHO), Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP), Hallmark, etc.

faqs.question: What components are encompassed in the cost for certification?
faqs.answer: The cost for certification will include fees charged by certification agency (excluding travel, hotel & surveillance charges), cost of testing equipment/machinery as required for certification, calibration charges of equipment.

faqs.question: What types of expenditures are deemed ineligible for assistance under the Scheme?
faqs.answer: Expenditure incurred for renewal of certificate shall not be eligible for assistance under the Scheme.

faqs.question: What is the operative period of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The operative period of scheme is from 20.05.2022 till 5 years that is 19.05.2027.
